sub_title: Research Engineer | Computer Vision | Sensor Signal Processing | AI | Robotics
summary:
I am fascinated by science & technology and motivated to integrate applied physics and learning algorithms to solve real-life problems. Passion and curiosity are aimed at translating scientific principles into useable technology which can support critical sectors. 

Along with an applied physics and electronics background, I got both industrial as well as research experience in working with computer vision, AI, and control algorithms. 

With an ambitious personality, I love to face challenging problems around us and drive towards unique solutions. Nature is my inspiration, everything we perceive around us is connected and holds boundless mysteries to be solved. I strongly believe that becoming a keen observer in following fundamental laws of nature will allow us to solve challenging problems in our society.

I usually enjoy everyday challenges that push the boundaries of my knowledge and gain new experience in my field of work. I love to work towards bridging the gap between academic research and industrial products thereby transforming ideas into innovations for the people.

Tools - Python, OpenCV, MATLAB/Simulink, Eclipse Platform, TensorFlow/Pytorch, CANanalyzer, AUTOCAD, ADAMS, C++, ROS, and Git/Gerrit

Scientific Interest - Sensor signal processing, Applied Physics, Biomedical systems, Machine learning, and AI, Advanced control systems, and Embedded systems.

Technical Skills - Computer Vision, Image/Signal Processing, Machine / Deep Learning, Control theory, Sensor Fusion, 2D/3D Modelling & Prototype development, Mechanical & Mechatronics systems.

projects.title: A Novel Motorized Contrivance And Walking Stick To Assist Paralytic Patient To Walk Without Assistant
projects.description: This Project aims in assisting the paralytic patient to walk without assistant and provide them with necessary stability while walking. Stability analysis and walking stick modification for the paralytic patient with necessary wheels and braking system is done using ADAMS.

projects.title: A Novel Technique To Asses The Quality Of Frying Oil Using Capacitive Transducer
projects.description: Simulating an electronic circuit and real time instrument that could be used to measure the quality of edible oil used for regular frying. These oils are prone to degradation at a faster rate than that is understood.  With repeated cycles of frying and increase in temperature, degradation occurs. A general increase in the dielectric constant is observed with the increase in the amount of polar compounds. The overall quality of the oil can be studied using these variations with the help of capacitive sensors.

projects.title: Mobile Robot Navigation using Robot Operating System (ROS)
projects.description:
Goal is to develop collaborative robotic systems for autonomous navigation.
-> Designing Akerman steering wheeled robot using Gazebo simulation. 
-> Sensor and hardware integration of wheeled Picar (Sunfounder - model) for collaborative real world navigation.
-> Developed a hybrid controller for simulated robot based on the input from real robot.

Tools: ROS, python, RaspberryPi

-> Impedance and force controller design and development

Tools: Matlab and Simulink

contributors.headline: Research Engineer | Computer Vision | Sensor Signal Processing | AI | Robotics

projects.title: Traffic Sign Recognition Under Challenging Conditions
projects.description: Developed a binary template based dynamic programming algorithm to recognize the road sign in real environment. The algorithm is also capable of denoising various challenging environmental conditions through noise reduction filters. Tested on four road signs and the results were promising without any learning techniques.

CV and ML Scientist at Univrses
Data Engineer at Trygg-Hansa
Associate Professor of Computer Engineering

projects.title: Analysis Of Modified Defects Detection Algorithms On Spray  Painted Truck Body Using Computer Vision Techniques
projects.description: The micro level surface defects identification requires computer vision algorithms.  Special computer vision algorithm is developed to identify defects such as bumps, scratch and combination of both scratch and bumps. The algorithm is developed with simple statistical, structural and filtering based techniques. The proposed algorithm clearly presents us with all defects including the undetected defects in traditional algorithms.  Achieved good qualitative and quantitative results compared to the traditional techniques.

projects.title: Control Of 6 DOF 3-RPRS Parallel Manipulator As Seismic Simulator.
projects.description: Analysis of 6DOF parallel manipulator and generate the workspace as required is the main aim. Then  reproducing seismic data in designed parallel manipulator and to analyze the strength of the prototype placed on the end effector of the parallel manipulator. Finally Controlling the manipulator according to the desired angle is done with PLC.

profile_positions.title: Summer Employee

profile_positions.description:
Robustness and safety verification of traffic sign image classification (CNN). Responsible for Deep Learning based algorithm development for autonomous vehicles. (Python, OpenCV, ML libraries) 
•	Worked on camera data and image processing techniques
•	Proposed generalized safety verification architecture for traffic sign classification
•	Developed effective predictive data augmentation techniques in contrast to traditional method to withstand vehicle type and weather variations occurring in the real roads. (Linux  and Windows Platform)
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Project

profile_positions.description:
Development of Computer vision and pattern recognition algorithm for automotive applications. Approx 25 hours part-time research in addition to 40 hours of full time study. Responsible for developing algorithms using MATLAB, Python, OpenCV, ML libraries. 
•	Defects detections (bump, scratch) on spray painted Volvo truck samples
•	Localization and recognition of traffic signs in video streams
•	Open source datasets used for road sign detection such as CURE-TSD and GTSRB 
•	Techniques: Image Processing, Pattern Recognition, Segmentation, Feature understanding, Filtering, Reconstruction, Machine/Deep Learning and Edge Detection
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant - Dr. Shafiq Ur Rehman and Dr. Sikandar Lal Khan (Immersive Interaction Lab)

profile_positions.description:
Development of novel exoskeleton system for hemiplegic patient and robotic manipulators. Responsible for background study, design, analysis and development of a prototype. (Approx 15 hours part-time research in addition to 40 hours of full time study) 
•	Exoskeleton includes sensor systems and actuator controlled based on reactive architecture. 
•	Stability analysis using ADAMS, MATLAB and AUTOCAD 
•	Prototype development of 6-DOF 3-RPRS Parallel Manipulator as a seismic simulator. 
•	Kinematic control using PLC and Arduino Controllers
